headline: Homemade Crispy Hash Browns
description: These crispy, homemade hash browns are quick, easy, and family-friendly, making them perfect as a side dish for any breakfast or brunch on weekdays or weekends.
name: Homemade Crispy Hash Browns
recipeIngredient: 1 cup oil for frying, or as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse shredded potatoes until water is clear, then drain and squeeze dry.
Place shreds in a bowl and mix in the onion, flour, and egg until evenly distributed.

Heat about 1/4 inch of oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. When oil is sizzling hot, place potatoes into the pan in a 1/2 inch thick layer. Cover the whole bottom of the pan, or make separate piles like pancakes.

Cook until nicely browned on the bottom, then flip over and brown on the other side. It should take at least 5 minutes per side. If you are cooking them in one big piece, it can be cut into quarters for easier flipping.
Remove from pan, and drain on paper towels. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Best hash browns ever! Followed exactly as recipe stated- even used the salad spinner to dry the shredded potatoes. Whole family agreed the best!

I had never made homemade hash browns before and this recipe was great! I added seasonings to my liking and used onion powder because I didn't have onions. This will definitely be my go to from now on! I made them into individual little cakes that are perfect for breakfast sandwiches and just overall easier to make for me. 10/10 definitely recommend
Really delicious - I added onion powder instead of fresh onion, recipe worked out perfectly.

We loved these and I'll definitely be using this recipe again! I'd never realized how much the TYPE of potato affects the way they "hash up" so this was enlightening. I added a little onion powder and garlic powder instead of the onion. I only used about 1/4 cup of oil, however, which was more than enough. Beautiful color, delightfully crispy/crunchy and delish!

To do a little more healthy version I baked them instead of fried them. I also added some Garlic and Chipotle Chili Pepper. It turned out great and was easy to make into their own individual cakes from the pan.

This is the first time I made it. I used corn starch instead of flour. I normally use corn starch ; Maizena when the recipe call for flour for the product stick together. Whenever I made fried fish the result is better than flour. Any way I was looking for hash brown not a tortilla. Next time I don't use Maicena or flour.
Instead of oil I used bacon fat and it added more favor.

This recipe turned out great. I put the oil on medium high while I peeled and shredded the potatoes and cut up the onion. Then I mixed it up. I did add extra onion because we love the onion flavoring in our hashbrowns. They were not greasy at all like I read in the reviews. Make sure your oil is really hot. They tasted great. My husband loved them.
Definitely don’t use that much oil, but great recipe

It's ok. I found them to be a bit greasy for my liking. I made them gluten-free by using 1-1 GF flour. I also used an egg substitute. I don't see much difference between potato latkes and this version of hash browns. I also added ham and cheese.

Fantastic hash brown recipe, tastes just like what you would get at a good diner! One tip if you're like me and have trouble flipping it within a skillet like this: use an oven safe skillet (I use my cast iron) and then instead of flipping, cook the first side for like 4 minutes instead of five and then broil it in the oven for a couple for a couple minutes. As long as you keep an eye on it, it crisps up REAL nice and you don't have to risk breaking it up
Good straight forward recipe. Had to still squeeze out excess before frying but they came out great. -

lot of mixed reviews- i, however , had no issue with "too much oil", the paper towel blotted it and left crispy hash browns. Bland, naturally, but chili seasoning and tomato sauce tasted very good !! Made a thorough effort in removing the potato water, mine came out super tasty! Got the thumbs up from my dad and brother too :)
Been making hash browns for years and never new a few simple ingredients would make them soooo yummy!!
A pleasure to make and wake friends up to. Thank you.
Super easy recipe. I added garlic and cheese to mine. Since I used already minced garlic which was wet, I dried it off and added a little extra flour and 1 extra egg
Turned out perfect.

I added more flour because I added 1/4 cup of Hatch peppers (minced) and they were a hit! My mix was “tacky”, sticky to touch but not gummy, then used a large spoon to dole 2 rounded spoonfuls per hash brown, gently placed in the oil and mashed them in the middle, watched browning and flipped after 4-5 min…Voila! Great basic hash brown recipe. Thanks.
It took a bit longer to cook, I added garlic powder and onion powder with salt pepper when adding in flour. Used large cast iron was great.

I am perfectly satisfied with a bag of frozen hashbrowns from the grocery store. Two tablespoons of flour sprinkled over the partially thawed potatoes should be sufficient, salt and pepper, and one egg. If you are making German Latkes, add some grated nutmeg. Two tablespoons of vegetable oil should be plenty. Oil heated to medium high (not smoking) is a good temperature. Don't want it to flame up. An ice cream scoop of potato flattened in the hot oil makes a nice size and easy to flip over when browned. Call me a Philistine, but I am not grating my own potatoes.

Oh boy I have made this recipe a few times !! I have to say I add meat and then I cook it up in the waffle Maker !!! its awesome they are so yu!my crispy and easy to air fry for early am reheat!!! I freeze three or more at a time! add meat oh so yummy!!

Usually when I follow an online recipe, I usually read the bad reviews first to get a general idea why they gave low ratings and 'flavor' is whatwas missing for this recipe. If you're like me and need a bit more flavor than salt and pepper then this is what I did. My changes: I diced two small onions one red and one white, with chives, flavor peppers, grated two cloves of garlic and 1/2 inch piece of ginger. Fried them with 1 TSP of oil until the onions became translucent. 5 small potatoes and 1 large. Added dried stake seasoning, cayenne pepper. 2 flax egg because we don't eat meat (egg) 1/4 cup or less of oil for frying I followed the rest of the recipe. I covered my frying pan with a cover on medium to low heat so the potatoes can cook properly. I used a tablespoon of oil for every four hash brown. And man they are delicious at brunch 😋
Delicious, didn't have an onion so subbed for onion powder, a dash of cayenne pepper and Italian herbs. Will make again!

Great eazy-peazy recipe! Tasted & looked like restaurant-style hash browns, except better! My only substitutions were garlic salt and I added a table spoon of store-bought minced garlic. I made a big batch since I was using my electric potato shredder. I froze several 'patties' between wax paper for a later quick & easier B'fast!

This is a great recipe - far better than plain, shredded potatoes. I halved the recipe since I only had one potato and just used the extra egg in some scrambled eggs. I don't care much for fresh onions, so I added onion powder and garlic powder instead. I just formed three portion-sized rounds for easy flipping and they turned out fabulous! Thanks for the great recipe :D
Tastes pretty good.

The instructions were so easy to follow. And the hash browns came out fantastic and so delicious! 
Thank you, Emily
Pretty good. Followed the recipe as is. Next time will punch up the flavour a little with additional spicing.
Yummmmy!!!
LOTS of work and mess. Made six 1/4 c. patties. Result browned well, but were pancake-y inside.
Delicious. Finally I make great hash browns. I added some paprika and turmeric.
Ok, didn’t like that much onion in it.
Soooooo good!!!! I added garlic powder, smoked paprika and some chilli flakes for a bit of a kick and they were so delicious!! Super easy and yum

Awesome recipe. I always had trouble getting my hash browns to stay together. The flour and egg completely cured that issue. Kids love them too! 2nd time I made them I added a tiny bit of garlic powder.

Too greasy and crispy following the recipe. Definitely use less oil! 
I added the entire misture into pan, kept a lower heat for a slower cook and mixed a few times before allowing hash browns to “set” and brown. Portion out in smaller pieces for ease in flipping and allow to finish cooking. 
Will definitely make again but following my cooking method and with less oil.
It was okay but I won't make it again.
Very delicious.
I used less oil
It was delicious and the precise instructions were really helpful.

Great Hashbrowns that stuck together just right! I used my new food chopper with a 2-liter capacity, pulsing chunked potatoes and onion then added the rest of the ingredients and carefully pulse chopped until desired texture. Transfer to a bowl to stir in egg evenly. Even when mixed ahead it was great.
I followed the directions and got a delicious Breakfast.
I made it! It was awesome! And I'll do it again
Great recipe, being an amateur cook I am confused as to why we are instructed to add salt and pepper after the hash browns are cooked, definitely in my saved recipes..
I added the salt into the main mixture instead of adding salt at the time of serve

Altho the recipe lists one cup of oil, the directions tell you to use 1/4 in. of oil to fry the hashbrowns. Perhaps those who complained of the finished potatoes being too greasy used the whole cup instead of 1/4 in. at a time. I thought they were good - and easy make additions according to taste such as cheese, green onions, additional herbs (I like thyme).
My first attempt at making hashbrowns so it turned out good. THANKS Emily
This recipe works texture-wise, but it's so terribly under-seasoned. Please, I'm begging you, add salt, pepper, cayenne, garlic powder, etc. to your potato mixture before you fry.
I’d never really drained my potatoes before making hash browns, nor included some onion. This was a great and easy recipe!
I don’t know if I did something wrong, but we didn’t like the taste of they hash browns, tasted like flour, and very bland. But like I said might have done something wrong.
They were ok. I cut oil down to about 1/4 cup. I think the flour, egg, onion took away from the pure satisfying potato taste I crave.
Perfect!!!!
This recipe was easy to follow and it tasted great!
Yummo.. I added a small amount of mixed herbs and white pepper.... delicious

I can’t really give an accurate rating since I made some significant changes i.e. not as much flour, egg and oil. However one suggestion I would have is to drain and spin shredded potatoes in a salad spinner. Also if you don’t want to shred the potatoes you could chop them very fine.

Great flavor! I stirred 1/2 t of salt, 1/4 t of pepper and 1/4 t of garlic powder into the flour, and cut the flour to 3 T, before stirring into the potatoes. I did rinse the shredded potatoes three times in a salad spinner, spun them and wrung them dry in a towel. Next time, I’ll spread the mixture thinner to get less of a pancake texture. Also plan to try adding 1/2 c of shredded sharp cheddar just for variety.
It's a big portion. Excellent hash browns.

Absolutely awful. Way too much flour and no directions on how to season them. Ended up making dog biscuits for my dog with this recipe rather than a lovely breakfast for my partner and I’s anniversary. Waste of time, traumatized. Won’t ever look at a hash brown the same way ever again.
Very good base recipe that can be built upon
We tried hash browns in our family trips to the UK, but had never made them at home back here in Buenos Aires. I’ve just made them for breakfast! (Note: we like them “dark brown”)
Flavor was balanced and the texture was perfect. Thanks for sharing your recipe
There is too much flour. It could also use salt and other spices like garlic to improve it.
Its good but it tastes better when you remove the egg from the ingredients
Really easy to make and the taste was exactly what I expected

I made this recipe in the hopes of getting that crunchy typical diner flavor but no it didn't taste bad but the texture of the flour and egg together is just too heavy, more cakey and not crunchy as i was expecting. Couldn't finish it actually.
Very good!
These were amazing! I’ve never had success making my own before and but will keep this recipe!

Awesome! I followed the suggestion to shred the zucchini first, mix it with double the salt, and drain it while prepping everything else. I also minced the onion with some garlic in a mini food processor and browned it before adding it back to the mixing bowl and cleaning the pan. Once mixed, I pan fried in a VERY SMALL AMOUNT of peanut OIL as other reviewers suggested. The result was my first latke ever. It didn't really resemble hash browns at all but that was just fine with us! Oh yeah and I only used about 2.5 Tbs of flour.

Thank you for posting this recipe
Delicious. I went a bit lighter on the oil and it was still good. Might try it again, with a potato and shredded zucchini blend.
I added a small tin of cream corn ,some pizza cheese and a cup of bread crumbs
I substituted onion powder and the taste was amazing!

Just wanted to say that the amount of oil SUGGESTED, was perhaps the most perfect amount of oil in the history of recipes ever created anywhere in the world ever. In fact the amount of oil suggested is worthy of 5 Michelin Stars, perhaps even the Nobel peace prize if such a thing is possible. The amount of oil suggested is so perfect, I feel the need to post it again for all the world to read, study, commit to memory and pass down to others for generations to come. 
"1 cup oil for frying, or as needed"
"....or as needed"
"...OR AS NEEDED"
Very good potato cake recipe. I made the recipe as directed, using some additional flavors we like—nothing exotic. I really liked the texture of the potato cakes.
We really enjoyed this recipes.

The hashbrowns turned out wonderfully with great flavor. However there's NO WAY I would use a full cup of oil as is stated in the recipe. I used 3 Tablespoons coconut oil and 2 Tbsp butter, and there was still a lot of oil left in the pan after cooking. So unless you prefer deep fried hashbrowns, I'd suggest decreasing the oil significantly.
Excellent.
Love the recipe. Added a dash of ground cumin to it and it tasted amazing. Definitely a keeper.
Easy, quick and tasty

Delicious! I made them as individual "pancakes " and everyone loved them. I added salt and pepper to the mixture before cooking. While I didn't use the amount of oil called for, you definitely need to ensure there's enough oil that when you turn them, the other side is in oil, not in a dry pan. The oil also needs to be very hot when you put them in - they need to sizzle! They're easily reheated on a medium heat in a frying pan coated in cooking spray. I used them as a side with pork chops and apples but am also adding these to my brunch offerings. Great with sour cream and/or apple sauce.

Delicious. Very easy to make. Everyone in my family loved it except the 6 year old! I added cracked pepper to my serving. I also finished them off in the oven to ensure they were cooked through as I was cooking the rest of them. Would be nice served with bacon!

Will definitely make it again... I love this whenever i get a chance i make it

Kids loved it even hubby (that's saying something) 
Overall i will make it again.. I did throw in a little bit cayenne pepper to make it a bit spicy it was great
Thank you so much for the recipe
Excellent recipe. Best for hashbrowns.
Heat was TOO HIGH. I'll try em again tho. They were VERY good. Maybe the best hash browns I ever had. Wife really liked em too!
Amazing and a keeper. Best hash browns ever
Easy and yummy

Mine turned out ok but the taste of oil was overwhelming. Next time I will not use that much oil. I notice at restaurants, they fry their hash browns on a grill and use little oil. In any event, we were very disappointed.
This was really good. I've made it for my mom's birthday, for normal breakfasts, and even for dinner. Our whole family enjoyed this. Thanks for the recipe, Emily.
Excellent. Followed the recipe and everyone loved it.

My son wanted hash browns, so I tried these. I substituted gluten free flour so I could enjoy them, too, and they came out great! I din't measure the oil; I just put a little in the bottom of the skillet. Thanks for an easy and delicious recipe.
Delish!
Absolutely perfect

It was fantastic, and loved by all. I have never gone through the extra "work" of rinsing and drying the potatoes, but this, along with the added egg and flour was a true hit!! It will be made quite often since these would go with ANY dish. Thanks for sharing the receipe!

I've never had luck with home made hash browns until now! I think next time I make this, I will lessen the flour, and season potatoes before frying. I used a cast iron skillet and shortening for cooking, and had no problem flipping in one piece. I also used a salad spinner to soak, rinse, and dry my potatoes. It worked great!

Very Tasty. I did add the bacon to it. I also put enough egg into it to make it more like a pancake. I am also lazy so I used frozen hash browns. Thawed them out, dried them out and then put in the micro for awhile to get out any moisture. Beware of the grease. Just coat the bottom of the pan.
great hashbrowns
great hardy stuff! Loved it!

Great proportions. I suggest adding more seasonings to your liking. Cook time was off for me but maybe my cast iron skillet got too hot too quick. I do suggest reheating leftovers in an air fryer or even finishing cooking in an air fryer to remove some of the grease.
I have made these many times. Perfect every time! I do not adjust the recipe at all.
Added shallots, bacon, paprika, garlic powder,, salt pepper to mixture
Not worth the effort. I found them to be a little on the bland side and too greasy for my taste. If I try it again I’ll use red potatoes.
